I like your idea. But to help make reinforced glass more obtainable and useful, its recipe should not include obsidian, which is already hard enough to get. Instead why not make the recipe include glass panes and iron ingots?
Love this! Since biomes are so large, I'd love to be able to travel back and forth between, say, a Jungle biome and my home base using linked portals.
Real cobwebs are EXTREMELY flammable, so why don't they already?

No. That's taking away the purpose of the Donkey.
If this were to be a thing I think the chest should be a saddlebag instead, and maybe only hold one or two items like food and water.
So it can be compatible with Multi Shot and Quick Charge? If so then I'm in.
It can't be compatible.
It should be.
好主意。现在弩有一个非常尴尬的情况。低伤害和慢速充电，就像不存在一样。这种结界可以使它与弓不同
It would be far too strong if combined, which is why I said it shouldn't. No one would ever use a bow again. That isn't the point of this enchant.

Leahyster, I like your idea a lot, because the crossbow is destined to be a mid-game weapon without the damage increases, however I think that the triple shot would be useless without having an enchantment to bring itself up with. So perhaps just triple shot being compatible with velocity.
I see your point. Here, I've updated the OP.
Hi I think this idea is great.
I like what you did with the upgrade but I really feel like it should be compatible with Quick Charge seeing that we don't have the Power with the Crossbow so it would be that overpowered.

@Blast Burner, did you read the post? Velocity has a damage aspect.

This is a damage-variant enchant for the Crossbow. Having a charge-up, pre-loadable, high damage, multishot item that charges faster than bows would render bows obsolete. Hopefully that makes more sense.

Good idea ngl however I think this would still make the crossbow slightly obsolete when it comes to bows... because, well, a bow with power V would be better than a crossbow with quick charge, because of far more damage, and better than a crossbow with velocity, because of similar damage and ages to reload. Maybe if it wasn’t mutually exclusive to quick charge, but reduced the effectiveness of quick charge by a decent amount, then it would work quite well
That's creative and kind of interesting actually! Voted
I'm not sure how I feel about this so I'll think about it.

I personally have an idea for Glazed Terracotta. Check it out since you like regular Terracotta.

Glowing Glazed Terracotta
It's an idea I haven heard, however I don't know if it needs to be in the game... Hoes I think need to be addressed before any other farming issue. However my vote is yours.
for me its a lot harder to see when they nether warts are ready

My suggestion is to make leaf blocks only intangible to flying mobs while in a flying state: bats, parrots and phantoms.

Mobs that are small enough or known to live in trees or bushes should treat them as scaffolding blocks.

This could include: bats, ocelots, parrots, rabbits, foxes, chickens, spiders, cave spiders, chicken jockeys, phantoms, silverfish, endermites, spider jockeys, cats, pandas, vexes and killer bunnies. (And monkeys and meerkats if/when they are added). Leaf blocks should act like scaffolding for these mobs, as in they can walk through them and travel through them in any direction including up and down, as well as stand on them or in them.  Update these mobs ability to naturally spawn on/inside leaf blocks.

I think everything else should still be stopped by leaf blocks including players.

Bonus: When a player is flying in creative or with an elytra, they could act like flying mobs and leaf blocks would become intangible. But if they stop flying while in a leaf block, they could travel through them like scaffolding until they are not inside a leaf block.  Also, if the player (or any mob) drops to or jumps to a leaf block, they should sink into it, at which point the leaf block would be treated as scaffolding until the player/mob again exits the leaf block.
Ok, so I completely agree with you on that but I would say that instead of surrounding the glazed terracotta with 4 glowstone, surround the glazed terracotta with 8 glowstone dust.
The reason why I said 4 instead of 8 is because we are mostly getting the glowing effect from the patterns but I think that could change to 8 instead. Thank you. :)

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.

Yes! I have a written book I carry around everywhere to keep track of projects and TODOs, and I never intend to sign it, because I constantly change the info. I live in constant fear of losing the book and pernamently forgetting the things I've written down!

And just a note on logic (which isn't nearly as important as opinion :) ), why does signing a book make it copyable all of a sudden?

Yes please! Why can't we copy books like maps where all copies are updated when any copy is? I guess you'd have to deal with multiple people potentially editing the book at once. Still as painful as it is to edit text in a book (I play on my Switch), please consider it!

I want to use the book and quill in game to keep track of in-game notes, however, I'm terrified of losing all of that hard work if the book ever gets lost or destroyed. I want to be able to make backup copies of a book that can still be written to. I don't want to have to re-write all my notes by hand. Until then, I'm far more likely to keep notes offline which breaks immersion.
It’s sounds cool but I think this would fall in a catagory in which it can be done in other ways like using trap doors or banners
What I'd Be able to build with block placement like on Space Engineers, this sounds just like it, you've earned my support for this idea

Yes, place any block any direction you want! 

Will require something to rotate them with, like a wrench. But I'm willing to go through scaffolding insanity for my sideways fense.
Hey just had this idea and was posting it when I saw yours. Im going to post mine anyway to double the chances of being discovered!

I like this idea. It could change things up with dispensers. But it might be a bit overpowered because it shoots infinite flaming arrows and it can go on forever, the bow it breaks eventually, the dispenser doesn't. Still a great idea, I would definitely use enchanted dispensers!
Okay but why does it have redstone dust in the recipe? Redstone and Coal are completely different things.
If you have trouble with getting TNT in survival, it's suppose to be difficult. Not everything in survival is gonna be easy.
Luckily I came up with a recipe already (Part2/3) Hot Springs Biome, Geysers, New Ore, A New Mob (The Vapor), and More

The recipe from IC2 is good. It is quite simple, accessible, and logical. The red dust in the recipe is analogous to real sulfur in gunpowder (children do not need to know the real recipe for gunpowder). It item give energy. Coal is ideal as a second ingredient, but not in the form of an object, but rather in the form of coal powder. For crafting powder need field 2X2, as for torch.

The essence of my post is not to come up with a ready-made recipe for the developers, but just to let know that the powder recipe is necessary in the game. And it must be relatively cheap and simple.

P.S. It would also be great to see a simple firearm in the game. For example, muskets. It charges for a long time, hits powerfully, wears quickly, consumes gunpowder from inventory and bullets. Without bullets, shoots at idle.
Sorry but any form of gun including tanks and cannons will never be added in Minecraft. You can get the in mods though.

(note the ideas in the post are merely suggestions as to what the abilities of mistletoe could be, it would be of course be up to Mojang to decide which ones to include to balance its abilities.

With that said here’s another potential use:

• The mistletoe staff: This would deal 2 damage points and can be crafted vertically from three mistletoe branches in the crafting grid. The mistletoe staff would have the ability to turn the damage it has dealt to your opponent into health and share it with other players or mobs holding a mistletoe branch in their inventory, the amount of health shared being equivalent to the damage done to your opponent by the staff, if you have more than one player holding a mistletoe branch then the health points would be given to the player with the least amount of health. Useful in certain battle situations I believe such as a fight with the wither or ender dragon.

I think the end should have its own unique items

This would definitely help give birch biomes (my favourite) a unique feel and purpose!

If this were to even be added at all, it would have to be nerfed a decent amount, or be difficult to craft, but this just doesn’t even fit with the medieval Neolithic time period that Minecraft seems to exist in.
